Dragons require a significant amount of space to roam and exercise, and if the owner does not have enough room, it can lead to stress and behavioral issues for the dragon.
Dragons are wild animals and can be unpredictable, which can make them dangerous to humans, especially if they are not properly trained.
Dragons have a strong predatory instinct and may attack smaller animals or even children if not properly supervised.
Dragons produce a lot of heat and require a specialized habitat to regulate the temperature.
Dragons are not domesticated animals and may have difficulty adapting to a human-centered environment.
